post.excerpt: Ingredients: Instructions: This stir-fry is a delicious and colorful combination of tropical flavors and nutrients. The quinoa is a great source of plant-based protein, and the combination of bell peppers, pineapple, and coconut milk gives the dish a sweet and savory taste. Enjoy!
post.content:
Ingredients:

  • 1 cup quinoa
  • 2 cups water
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 red bell pepper, diced
  • 1 green bell pepper, diced
  • 1 cup pineapple chunks
  • 1 red onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro

Instructions:

  1. Rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh sieve and drain.
  2. In a medium saucepan, bring the quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the quinoa is tender and the water has been absorbed.
  3. In a large wok or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the bell peppers, pineapple, onion, and garlic and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
  4. Stir in the cumin, chili powder, and salt.
  5. Add the cooked quinoa and coconut milk to the pan and stir to combine.
  6. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the coconut milk has been absorbed and the quinoa is hot.
  7. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

This stir-fry is a delicious and colorful combination of tropical flavors and nutrients. The quinoa is a great source of plant-based protein, and the combination of bell peppers, pineapple, and coconut milk gives the dish a sweet and savory taste. Enjoy!
post.title: Tropical Quinoa Stir-Fry
